comments.comment: Glad he’s taking us all along the ride on this beautiful journey.

I happen to live in Okinawa and I actually saw Felix at the aquarium, but I didn’t want to bother him and Marzia. I hope you enjoyed our beautiful island pewds!
P.s he’s shorter in person, but don’t tell him I said that
Always amazed by Marzia's editing style, so fluid, so smooth and so soothing, I love it very much. These vlogs deserve to stay ️

I lived in Okinawa for 7 years, but unfortunately had to move back to the states. I hope to move back soon. This video has brought back so many memories, especially the way you styled and edited the video, in the most calming, peaceful manner there is, a very nice break from how flashy and loud YouTube is. I cannot express how surreal it is to see you, one of the biggest creators on the platform, visiting the tiny island I lived in, and the places I’ve been to. All the best to you and your family!
saw this was uploaded yesterday; saved it for later and saw it was private but figured it would be uploaded soon; love these vlogs very much!
The way you guys travel is so wholesome and respectful to the culture of a place. Considering you’re completely loaded you’re so grounded and kind. Watching this makes me feel so peaceful and happy.

I keep saying this but as an old fan, seeing this man from then and now is so surreal. He's grown so much and he's at the prime of his life just enjoying his time with the wife while the baby is on the way...it's so inspiring ️
日本に来てくれてありがとう！

I dont know why but this video just makes me so happy.. like the vibes are unmatched and just to think that I grew up watching Pewds play video games for so many years and now to see him just live life to the fullest, exploring places, marrying Marzia and having a baby soon.. it just feels so cool

It's so nice to see how a positive attitude and "going with the flow" can make what some people would call a disaster (not seated together on the plain, weather forcing the cancelation of certain plans) a really pleasant trip. They found other fun things to do, enjoyed the island, and didn't throw a fit. People like this make Youtube actually fun. Thanks for being normal, respectful, grateful human beings.
誰よりも日本を奥深く紹介してくれる貴方に感謝
私は沖縄県に住んでます。来てくれてありがとう。

I just want to say how inspiring even these vlogs are. Like…the fact that you went on a trip and had a bad weather and you didn’t let it bother you and found other activities to enjoy…I’m still learning to enjoy the present, even if i have all planned out and it doesn’t work out the way that I wanted, then at the end of the day it’s all about the perspective. 
So thank you Felix and Marzia, I love you guys so much

i know we can't know everything from their relationship in these videos, but it really does seem so wholesome and loving. makes me feel so happy and warm inside when i see them together in these vlogs :)
沖縄は見るべきものが沢山あるし、日本人から見ても個性的な郷土料理が沢山あるので何度も足を運んで見てください。世界遺産も点剤していますし、音楽や踊りなどの文化も素晴らしいです。石垣島などの離島も良いですよ。

Lived in Okinawa Japan for two years for the military 2020-2022. Such a beautiful place. Aquarium was amazing. Loved driving to Naha and Nago. The arcades and thrift shops were so fun too. Such a small island but with so much to do. Glad you both enjoyed it!
i honestly can't help but smile whenever i see felix and marzia living such a beautiful and happy life, i know we don't see everything that goes on, but what we do see is beautiful
Felix and Marzia are just way too wholesome. Just living their best lives in Japan ️
I feel so happy just by watching pewds and marzia enjoying to the fullest

沖縄10年以上行ってないなぁ。

この動画観たら、また行きたくなった。

So devastating that a large part of the castle was destroyed by a fire. It's frustrating that structures like that were able to survive numerous wars and climate change, yet it just takes one simple electric fire to take it down. It was really awesome that Felix and Marzia participated in volunteering in the reconstruction.  I know Felix said he's not sure if they did much, but I'm confident that every little bit brings the island one step closer to reconstructing and rebuilding the structure.
When felix upload videos like this its like im the one traveling in japan Its super relaxing and im glad he's taking us with his journey.

I'm just loving this content. I've never been a fan of vlog style content but I guess it all depends on who the creator is. These are so wholesome and comforting and Marzia's editing makes it even lovelier
沖縄は何回行っても本当に飽きない
You two have changed so much, it's weird to see how much all of us have grown up. Im glad we grew up together Felix
I live in Okinawa, and it was very cool seeing you explore this beautiful island! A fun fact: Churaumi Aquarium is the largest aquarium in Japan, and one of the largest in the world!
There is so much peace and hope in these vlogs. I love how Felix and Marzia are always filming each other, that is so wholesome.
I like the fact that his light hearted vlog actually help promoting local community.
Each vlog is like a short film. I always feel bitter sweet at the end... Thank you, Felix, for such delightful adventures!

The opportunity to travel is rare and to discover Okinawa when I was younger, my favourite location in the whole wide world, thank you for taking us along you and Marzia’s journey, continue to explore the world, and hope the happy days further along the years, sending my best wishes from Hong Kong! 🇭🇰
There’s something warm and comforting just watching pewds and Marzia’s vlogs just enjoying there life to the fullest.
My mom grew up in Okinawa and she really wants to take me there when I turn 16. It was great to see your experience so I have and Idea of what to do when we're there.
最高。こうやって日本のよいところを発信してくれるのはありがたいです。

I lived in Okinawa for 5 years and seeing this video warms my heart! I absolutely loved that island and the people there. Even with bad weather it's an incredibly fun time! I'm glad you and Marzia had a great time there!!!

PewDiePie low-key living that life I never thought I wanted...
The sudden urge to enjoy the little things is a great joy
Awesome. I was stationed in Okinawa. For four years. So much fun memories.
Lived in Okinawa for 3 years one of the most beautiful places in the world and I miss it so much
I've been following you for almost a decade now, and exploring Japan has always been my lifelong dream. Thank you for letting me live vicariously through you and your gorgeous relationship.
It's such a shame, I was going to be spending a week in Okinawa in February. Of 2020. Needless to say that trip never happened. Hopefully soon, though! Glad you guys had fun, Felix!
沖縄で壁紙職人YouTuberをしています！沖縄に遊びに来ていたのですね♪今度沖縄に来るときには、ぜひ声をかけてください！龍の写真が撮れる不思議なスピリチュアルスポットに案内しますよ～

I grew up for 6 years of my life in Okinawa. Hope to make it back again someday, but the island and history of Okinawa is beautiful and definitely worth the trip for anyone wanting a Japanese experience with a tropical island feel.
Felix's Japan vlogs are just so fun to watch. I'll never get tired watching and rewatch his Vlogs.
These vlogs are some wholesome content !! It’s very refreshing because I don’t find it much on YT anymore and idk Pewds and Marzia just have that vibe that you could watch them all day
It’s one of the best videos I’ve seen in a long while! I’m so happy for you two:(

This vlog made me actually tear up and made me so happy. I've deployed 3 times out to Okinawa and they were some of the best times I had while I was in the military. I was actually happy and the atmosphere Definitely helped with that. It's amazing how much they have fit on the island. I miss the beautiful beaches and the vending machines with Georgia Coffees at every corner. I hope one day I could go back

These videos are so amazing to watch especially as a fan. Years of anticipation for their move to Japan and seeing them live in peace. You never see genuine happiness and peace. Thank you for the laughs and memories over the years, brofist
Obsessed with having the privilege to watch these two living their best lives! Thank you for sharing your adventures with us!!
- I feel so happy just by watching pewds and marzia enjoying to the fullest.

I just have to say, I think Felix and Marzia are the best vloggers of our time. I get so much peace and joy from watching these vlogs, I don't get that from watching others. Really love you guys and glad you're passionate with this content. Can't wait for more!
As an Okinawan it’s cool to see you explore these areas that I’ve grown up around! Keep up the vlogs and enjoy your stay :)
After living there for 5 years, it makes me happy to see people experience it too! The aquarium is the absolute best. Never been to another that’s as beautiful as the one in Okinawa.
I was born and lived in Okinawa for 9 years. Seeing this fills me with nostalgia

I went on a pretty spontaneous trip to Japan in 2018 and after seeing your video back then, I made sure to visit Okinawa as well. I wasn't sure what to expect, didn't have a driver's license either. Even almost decided not to go when the day before I would fly there, all flights were cancelled because of a typhoon. It ended up being one of the best trips ever with some of the best weather. I explored so much by foot, went on a ferry to a smaller island to go snorkelling, had awesome food while chatting with the restaurant owner and saw Shuri castle. I didn't even know it burned down the next year until now, such a shame. I would've never thought to go to Okinawa if not for your video so thank you :)
Thank you for your happiness, Felix & Marzia. You know what they say: happiness is contagious; and I’m happy watching you grow happier each and every day at Japan
I lived in Okinawa for 5 years, my first memories are from there and the beginning of my childhood. Gorgeous location, people, and so so so much history to honor and appreciate.

石垣島だっ♬
来てくれてありがとうございます
次はぜひ、春に来てください。天気も良くて過ごしやすいですよ。

Ishigaki Island♬
Thank you for coming 
Next time you come, try coming in spring. The weather is nice and it's easy to spend time there.

It’s truly amazing how felix goes from laughing about things to exploring beautiful environments like Okinawa, I know his kid is gonna have a awesome childhood seeing that it’s one of pewds best talents

I know parasocial relationships are bad and weird but I can't help to view Felix as a sort of father figure! Having grown up with him since amnesia and his videos always making me smile in the darkest times. I'm really thankful for you Felix and I wish you all the best with you're future!
Japan is such an incredibly beautiful country.
Love him he’s a legend. I had a small YT channel myself & SO HAPPY he’s back… RESPECT

Somehow I cant just click on the next video after this. I feel so in peace and satisfied seeing you guys having such a wonderful time and being so in sync in life. Really inspiring. I think I will take this energy and do something else, than just scrolling.
couldn't be more happy for these two. For us to be able to see a part of their journey is a true blessing.

there is a peacefulness when I see this version of PewDiePie I'm 23 years old I remember when him and smosh use to be the top people of YouTube I always have a place in my heart for this man and hope you guys too.

its been a year and 11 days since I PCS'ed out of Okinawa, and ive had flashbacks of my 5 years over there. Me and my wife miss it every chance we think back on it. I also miss Kamisushi. I miss you, Kaichou!!!
Never think about Japan having such beautiful, tropical places. It really has everything!

I swear I saw this yesterday and got really exited 
You are both amazing people and it’s really fun to watch you just be awesome together along with your interesting editing and comforting style. This new content brung me back to the YouTube channel I loved so deeply as a child as I feel it has grown with me!! Thank you Felix!!

love this video. been living in Okinawa for 2 years now. I felt like ive done everything here. such a small island but this video made me realize there's so much more to do. thank you Felix and Marzia!
Have been to Okinawa many times.. love it there!
Legends know that this is a repost
As an old fan it just brings me so much happiness seeing them live their best lives man
Dude became a wholesome reaction channel and I'm honestly here for it. Do what you gotta do pewds
Your writing style is fantastic – informative yet easy to follow. I learned a lot from this article. Thanks for sharing!
For those of us who are unable to visit these beautiful places in the world thank you for sharing your experiences & letting us all live vicariously through you.
these Japan vlogs are so relaxing. loving them more than any other vlog series
As Japanese, I'm glad that you two are having a peaceful time in Japan.
Okinaww is sich a beautiful place to be. Been stationed for awhile now but soon leaving. Going to miss it. Happy y'all had a good time

I grew up watching my brother watch pewdiepie and he was always very happy watching pewds so I began to watch him around the same age as my brother and I feel like I have missed so much yet I am experiencing an amazing era at the same time. Thank you for helping multiple people from the same family, and some many individuals from around the world. You will always have a special place in my heart <3
Just here to say High Boi says congrats on the baby and gave everyone clear instructions to protect your child at all costs. That is all.
As someone who is desperate to visit Japan for the first time, I absolutely love seeing these travel and culture vids, Pewds! They're so fun and relaxing.
I live in Okinawa right now, it’s so amazing to see your experience in this amazing spot!

I've been living in okinawa for almost 2 years now and I can say January had some of the strongest winds that we had in the time I've been here. I'm so happy to see you guys having fun trying out all these things. Even stuff I've haven't heard of doing!

It’s always so mind blowing to me that Pewds, a guy that was known for screaming at barrels and playing horror games, is now a married man living life to the fullest, and in my opinion, has won life.

Congrats pewds

Watching this from the hospital waiting room as my girlfriend gets an epidural I've been watching pewds since I was 13. I'm 23 now and he always brings me comfort and makes me laugh! Wish Felix and Marzia the best of luck on your journey into parenthood!
That sea view looks straight out of a Ghibli movie. Gorgeous!
Even as Japanese I truly enjoyed watching this movie (I have never been to Okinawa).  Thank you the lovely vlog Marzia and Pewds!  お二人とお腹の赤ちゃんが健やかに生活されますように！

I used to live in Okinawa for most of my childhood, so I always appreciate these vlogs. My dad spent his late decade working there as a pilot. It makes me cry a little, knowing that I won't be able to go back with him. I hope I can visit again soon. I'm glad you had a fantastic time :)

These vlogs make me feel at ease, even it's just for the duration of the video  Also gives me encouragement to work on bettering myself & my career to be able to eventually have the priviledge to experience moments like these that you are having!

Thank you for providing these personal moments with us all, and look forward to more!
It was honestly so freaking nice I. Okinawa I served for two years there. I don’t remember a single day where I genuinely felt like I had nothing to do

Been subbed since 2013. Watching your Japan vlogs makes me feel so warm inside. I teared up a bit because I can see your pure joy. You’re finally living the life you’ve always dreamed of. So happy for you both :)

This makes me so happy to watch. I'm 22 now, but I've been watching you since I was 11. I can't wait for you and Marzia to have a family. Seeing you both on this journey has been so touching and heart-warming. I truly wish you both the best in everything. <3 Thank you for all of the great entertainment over the years
I love how calm, atmospheric, and cinematic these vlogs are. Absolutely awesome

Thank you for coming to Okinawa!!
There's bautiful oceans!!
   by Japanese
i am so proud of how far you’ve come, Felix. It brings me to tears!
That was so relaxing and cool to see. Japan is beautiful and you guys together is just so wholesome to watch. Love these vlogs
i cry everytime i watch one of his irl vids, im just so happy to see them enjoy such beautiful places. they deserve it
Cool! Lived in Okinawa before! Thanks for sharing this video!
I lived in Okinawa for 2 years when I was a teen. I feel like a piece of Okinawa will always be with me. I miss that place so much! Thank you for this video!
I find myself genuinely sad when your vlogs are over, I love Japan and I find it so beautiful. Hope to go there one day.
Man, these Japan vlogs make me so happy. So peaceful and relaxing.
Living in Okinawa is so wholesome! Highly recommend everyone to try to go if you can!
This gives so much of a nostalgic vibe to it, like im seeing the world through my childhoods sight
why does every pewds video feels soo personal and nostalgic in a way that this might be his last video ,its such a weird thing that i can't even describe it properly
this is the absolute VIBE, DUDE! love this chill saga for you guys, you've earned this bliss.
So much fun TODAY
12:33 marzia is so pretty i could CRY. You guys are going to have the cutest family 🥹
19:15 "he looked at me!" was so wholesome for some reason
After living in Japan for 8 years, Naha and Ishigaki has been my favorite places to visit. Okinawa really is special
I might sound ridiculous rn, but videos like this remind me that true genuine love still exists. It just heals something in me. I wish you guys all the best
It's so nice to see people you admire living a happy life :) hope you're doing great and continue doing what you want!

It's crazy to see how far Felix has grown over these past years. I remember Felix being the first channel I watched and subbed to back in 2011 when I was 6. I cant express how truly grateful I am, thank you Felix and Marzia
The glass blowing and the aquarium were really cool to see. Really enjoy these vlogs that Felix does. It feels like he takes us along for the ride while we watch.

Thanks for the tour, Felix and Marzia! We just got back from Ishigaki/Sakura/Tokyo. It was our first time, and it was glorious (we made our own tour video)  Lucky for us (my son and I) we had my partner, Mana, translate - otherwise, we would've been communicating with hands and feet!
I am very happy that someone like you came to Japan.

It’s good to see that you two got to experience Okinawa and see how it is different from mainland Japan. I was stationed in Okinawa as a U.S. Marine in 1990-1991, had a blast and left part of my heart there, and was able return in 2018 and take video of both my old haunts, as well as Shuri-Jo before it tragically burned down in the fire.
these videos aren’t even for us. they’re for him. and i appreciate him showing us.
Dream vacation, i would love to work and live in Japan for a time. Love that both of you are learning new crafts. Beautiful family!
The whole time watching this, I had a big smile on my face ️ It brings to me so much joy to see Felix and Marzia enjoying their lives in peace ️ We love you!️️️
These vlogs are so calming and I honestly wouldn't mind if they were one hour long
I was stationed in Okinawa for about 3 years it’s awesome to see spots that I’ve visited again thanks Felix enjoy your time

He really did do the YouTube run. Started by gaming. Dabbled in streaming. Hit ALL the biggest numbers and records. Weathered some scandals. And finally retired with happiness. Love of his life, a family and paradise in Japan. It’s such a dream come true
There’s nothing that makes me happier than seeing you two happy
This was so pleasant to watch, I love seeing you guys explore Japan together!

I used to watch you when i was introduced to youtube, now i am 20 years old and having the worst time of my life (i know i am just 20) but its depressing. I was literally missing you and searched you on youtube. its good you re having a good life with the person you love. Good luck Brother.
Truly a great vlog.
I lived in Oki for 10 years. Best childhood a kid could ask for. It’s been 12 years since I have been back. So many memories… man I miss it so much! thank you for sharing
Honestly Loving these vlogs Felix. Congratulations!

This  video is sooo awesome. I was born in Okinawa Japan and too young to really remember it to the best. living in the States now, but I've always wanted to go back there someday... but will probably never be able to afford it  thanks for giving me this little slice of childhood, pewds
Kudos to you for creating such valuable content. It's evident that you're passionate about this topic, and it shows in your writing.
This was so beautiful that they uploaded it a second time.
High Boi sends his congrats on the new baby. way to go.
Love Japan and Tokyo.  Happy you are getting to experience all of this.   Japan in my opinion has some of the best food and restaurants in the world.  We need more spirit like this in the States!
This was my childhood you brand back so many of my memories with this video I’ve recognized so many places and seen how it’s changed since I left back in 2018
Such cool places to visit!
Absolutely stunning, Pewds. Really happy for you and Marzia. Bless you both
High Boi says congrats on your baby!
The smaller islands around Okinawa are absolute gems too.
Being 30 now but a teen back then. Its amazing to see Felix just be himself outside of gaming. <3
High Boi sends his congrats on the new RGB baby, also lovely video omg, what an experience!

This is my fav pewdiepie area  
It's so calming, you're just living life and I'm all here for it
To think 79 years ago all there was on that island was death but now there is beauty.
